definitions.definition: carrying or bearing a load, especially a large one.
(of a firearm) charged with ammunition.
containing in abundance or to excess.
examples: your average chocolate bar is loaded with fat

definitions.definition: having a lot of money; wealthy.
examples: she doesn't really have to work—they're loaded

definitions.definition: having had too much alcohol; drunk.
examples: man, did I get loaded after I left his house

definitions.definition: (of a car) equipped with many optional extras; deluxe.
weighted or biased toward a particular outcome.
examples: a trick like the one with the loaded dice

definitions.definition: (of a word, statement, or question) charged with an underlying meaning or implication.
put a load or large amount of something on or in (a vehicle, ship, container, etc.).
examples: they load up their dugout canoes

definitions.definition: place (a load or large quantity of something) on or in a vehicle, ship, container, etc.
examples: stolen property from a burglary was loaded into a taxi
synonyms: put away "Larry loaded boxes into the jeep"

definitions.definition: (of a ship or vehicle) take on a load.
examples: when we came to the quay the ship was still loading

definitions.definition: take, buy, or consume a large amount of.
examples: I just went down to the store and loaded up on beer

definitions.definition: make (someone or something) carry or hold a large or excessive amount of heavy things.
examples: Elaine was loaded down with bags full of shopping

definitions.definition: supply someone or something with (something) in overwhelming abundance or to excess.
examples: the King and Queen loaded Columbus with wealth and honors

definitions.definition: bias toward a particular outcome.
examples: the odds were loaded against them before the match
synonyms: fix; weight "the dice are loaded against him"

definitions.definition: charge (a firearm) with ammunition.
examples: prime, charge, prepare to fire/use he loaded a gun

definitions.definition: insert something into (a device) so that it can be operated.
examples: load your camera before you start

definitions.definition: insert (something) into a device so that it will operate.
examples: load the cassette into the camcorder
synonyms: slot "load the cassette into the camcorder"

definitions.definition: transfer (a program or data) into memory, or into the central processor from storage.
add an extra charge to (an insurance premium) in the case of a poorer risk.
